Feb 13.detail: A 50-year-old man in Vinh Phuc Province, the father of one of the infected Vietnamese workers of Japan-based Nihon Plast Company Limited who’d been sent to Wuhan for training last November, has tested positive for novel coronavirus

Feb 13.title: 44 more cases on Diamond Princess cruise ship anchored off Japan
Feb 13.detail: There have now been 218 cases confirmed on the cruise ship, taking the total number of infections in Japan to 247. Of the newly diagnosed infections, 43 are passengers, and one a member of the crew.  Authorities now want to move elderly people off the ship if they test negative for the virus, offering to put them in government-designated lodging. There are now questions about whether the quarantine on the ship is working, with dozens of new cases diagnosed almost daily.

Feb 13.title: 14th case of new coronavirus confirmed in the U.S.
Feb 13.detail: The patient is one of the passengers who arrived on a State Department-chartered flight from Wuhan, China, to Marine Corps Air Station Miramar in San Diego on Friday. All passengers on that flight have been under a federal 14-day quarantine since arriving in the U.S. This is the second passenger from Wuhan to be diagnosed. The two patients were on different flights and have had no contact.

Feb 12.title: Ninth case found in UK
Feb 12.detail: A woman who flew into London from China a few days ago is being treated for coronavirus, bringing the total number of UK cases to nine.

Feb 12.title: 3 new cases of COVID-19 in Singapore, including DBS employee, 2 church employees
Feb 12.detail: Of them, two are from the Grace Assembly of God church, and one of them works at DBS bank at the Marina Bay Financial Centre. All three of them are Singaporean and have no recent travel history to mainland China. The two patients linked to the church are two male employees aged 34 and 46. The church will stop all church services and activities for two weeks. The DBS employee is 62 years old. This brings the number of confirmed cases of the virus in Singapore to 50.

Feb 12.title: Hong Kong reports 50th confirmed case
Feb 12.detail: The patient is a 51-year-old restaurant worker and colleague of a woman who attended a family hotpot meal that was linked to 11 other infections.

Feb 11.title: Japan cruise ship coronavirus cases climb to 175, including quarantine officer
Feb 11.detail: Another 39 people have tested positive for the coronavirus on the quarantined Diamond Princess cruise ship in Japan as well as one quarantine officer, bringing the total to 175.

Feb 11.title: Thailand reports 1 new case of coronavirus, brings total to 33
Feb 11.detail: The new case is a 54-year-old Chinese woman from Wuhan who was put in quarantine after coming into contact with another Chinese virus patient while in Thailand.

Feb 11.title: Germany confirms two more cases of coronavirus, raising overall number to 16
Feb 11.detail: The two new cases of coronavirus are related to infections among staff at a company in the Starnberg district west of Munich. Car supplier Webasto said last month a Chinese employee had tested positive for the virus upon returning to China following a visit to the headquarters near Munich. The employee apparently infected several German colleagues during the visit.

Feb 11.title: Seven more cases confirmed in Hong Kong, taking city’s total number to 49
Feb 11.detail: One of the new cases was connected to a shared family hotpot meal during Lunar New Year while three more were related to the 42nd case, a woman who lives at Hong Mei House in Tsing Yi's Cheung Hong Estate. The woman's son and his wife, who stayed with her, as well as the son's father-in-law, were all infected. They had some gatherings and activities during Lunar New Year, but no travel history. Three other cases concerning a 59-year-old church employee who worked in Siu Sai Wan, a 71-year-old man who lived in Po Lam Estate and a 66-year-old Tuen Mun resident, were not connected to previous clusters.

Feb 11.title: 2 new coronavirus cases in Singapore, including second Bangladeshi worker and RWS casino employee
Feb 11.detail: One had worked at the same location as another Bangladeshi coronavirus patient, the other is a Singapore permanent resident (PR) who lives in Johor Bahru and works at Resorts World Sentosa Casino. This brings the number of cases in Singapore to 47, with seven in critical condition. A total of 25 cases in Singapore are local transmissions.

Feb 11.title: 2 more evacuees confirmed infected with virus
Feb 11.detail: The patients are both Japanese nationals who were among those evacuated on government-chartered flights from the Chinese city of Wuhan late last month. One of them is a male resident of Wuhan in his 50s. He returned to Japan on the first chartered flight on January 29. The other is a resident of Saitama Prefecture near Tokyo. The man, who is in his 40s, was repatriated on the second chartered flight on January 30. The results of the tests they had right after returning home were negative. But they later exhibited symptoms, including fever, and were confirmed infected in subsequent tests.

Feb 11.title: Vietnam confirms 3-month-old baby is country’s 15th case
Feb 11.detail: The patient is a three-month-old baby residing in the Binh Xuyen District in Vinh Phuc province and was likely infected by her grandparent. She tested positive on Feb. 9

Feb 11.title: First case of coronavirus confirmed in San Diego
Feb 11.detail: San Diego confirmed its first case of coronavirus Monday. The individual was aboard the first flight from Wuhan.

Feb 11.title: S. Korea reports 1 more case of novel coronavirus, total now at 28
Feb 11.detail: The latest patient is a 30-year-od Chinese woman who is an acquaintance of the country's third confirmed case. She is currently being quarantined at a Seoul hospital.

Feb 10.title: Indian has been confirmed as the 8th coronavirus case in UAE
Feb 10.detail: The eighth confirmed case of new coronavirus in the UAE is an Indian national who had interacted with a recently diagnosed person.

Feb 10.title: A string of newly confirmed cases citywide reported from Monday evening into the early hours of Tuesday brings local total to 42
Feb 10.detail: A string of newly confirmed cases citywide reported from Monday evening into the early hours of Tuesday brings local total to 42. More than 100 residents in 35 households at a public estate in Hong Kong were evacuated in the early hours of Tuesday after two people in the block were confirmed to have contracted the coronavirus. The precautionary move was sparked by the case of a 62-year-old woman on the third floor of Hong Mei House at Cheung Hong Estate. She was Hong Kong's 42nd case. She was found to have lived directly below a man on the 13th floor, who was confirmed earlier to be Hong Kong's 12th case. Records showed she visited Macau from January 18 to 19.   All flats numbered 7 on every floor had to be vacated so their piping could be inspected.

Feb 10.title: Hong Kong confirmed infections in two new patients, bringing Hong Kong's official tally so far to 38.
Feb 10.detail: Hong Kong confirmed infections in two new patients, bringing Hong Kong's official tally so far to 38. Police were searching for two Hong Kong residents on the run after flouting quarantine rules introduced over the coronavirus outbreak. Those breaching the quarantine orders will be given a warning for a 'first offence', or simply reminded to stay indoors. Since the new measure was introduced on Saturday, a total of 1,193 people arriving from the mainland had been ordered to quarantine themselves for 14 days.

Feb 10.title: 2 new coronavirus cases in Singapore
Feb 10.detail: One is a Certis Cisco employee who served quarantine orders on two people from Wuhan, and the other is a two-year-old Singapore citizen who was one of the Singaporeans evacuated from Wuhan on Jan 30.

Feb 10.title: UK cases double as four more people diagnosed
Feb 10.detail: The new cases are all linked to a British man who caught the virus at a conference in Singapore and travelled to a ski resort in France. He was diagnosed in Brighton, and is being treated at St Thomas' Hospital in London. He is also linked to the fourth UK patient, who was exposed to the virus in France, while five British nationals tested positive in France following his trip to the ski resort.

Feb 10.title: Japan finds 66 more coronavirus infections on Diamond Princess cruise ship
Feb 10.detail: The number of coronavirus cases on board the vessel quarantined in Yokohama has risen to 136. The health ministry is considering testing all of the 3,700 people aboard the ship when the two-week quarantine ends.

Feb 10.title: 18th person diagnosed with novel coronavirus in Malaysia
Feb 10.detail: A Malaysian man who had visited mainland China before returning home in February is the latest person to be diagnosed with the novel coronavirus. The 31-year-old man who was working in Macau was unwell and started coughing on Feb 3. On Feb 7, the man still hadn't recovered. He was suffering from pneumonia and needed intensive monitoring. He tested positive for 2019-nCoV on Sunday (Feb 9).

Feb 9.title: Hong Kong confirms seven new cases of coronavirus infections, bringing tally to 36
Feb 9.detail: The seven new cases of novel coronavirus infection involves three family clusters. They are all family members and relatives of the a 24-year-old male patient reported earlier today. The first family cluster included the male patient's father (68-year-old), mother (57-year-old) and maternal grandmother (91-year-old). The second family cluster included the third younger sister (51-year-old) of the male patient's mother and the male patient's cousins (25-year-old female and 22-year-old male). The third family cluster included the fourth younger sister (50-year-old) of the male patient's mother and the male patient's cousin (23-year-old male). According to the 24-year-old patient's information, he had no travel history during the incubation period. On January 26, he had hot pot with 18 relatives, including the above 8 confirmed cases.

Feb 9.title: 3 new cases confirmed in Singapore
Feb 9.detail: These include a 71-year-old Singaporean man, a 39-year-old man from Bangladesh and a 54-year-old Singaporean man. This takes the total number of cases in Singapore to 43. Of these, six are in critical condition in intensive care. Four more cases have also been discharged.

Feb 9.title: Hong Kong confirms three new cases of coronavirus infections, bringing tally to 29
Feb 9.detail: Two of the confirmed cases are linked to the seven who tested positive, with all of them part of a larger family gathering.The health authorities said seven others who had a hotpot and barbecue meal with two of the three patients among the new confirmed cases also tested positive for the disease. The family gathering linked to the two new confirmed cases – a man, 24, and his grandmother – was held on January 19 at the Lento Party Room in Kwun Tong, involving 19 people in all, including two relatives from mainland China who have since left the city. The other new confirmed case is a 70-year-old man who has not travelled out of Hong Kong since January 9, spending most of his time at home.

Feb 9.title: Fourth case of infection diagnosed in UK
Feb 9.detail: Tthe latest infection was linked to France. The new case is a known contact of a previously confirmed UK case, and the virus was passed on in France.

Feb 9.title: Spain confirms 2nd virus case
Feb 9.detail: The coronavirus case was detected in Mallorca, a popular vacation island in the Mediterranean Sea. The Spanish Health Ministry said the person was one of four suspicious cases admitted last Friday to the Son Espases University Hospital in Palma de Mallorca. The other three tested negative.

Feb 9.title: Malaysia confirms 17th coronavirus case, woman related to Singapore conference attendee
Feb 9.detail: The 65-year-old Malaysian is the mother-in-law of Malaysia's first citizen case of coronavirus - a 42-year-old Malaysian man believed to have contracted the virus while attending a conference at the Grand Hyatt hotel in Singapore.  The woman had direct contact with her son-in-law when they sat at the same table during Chinese New Year celebrations on Jan 26, Jan 27 and Jan 28.

Feb 9.title: S. Korea adds 3 more virus cases for 27 total
Feb 9.detail: A 51-year-old South Korean man and a 37-year-old Chinese woman, who returned here after staying in China's Guangdong province from November to Jan. 31, have tested positive for the virus. Another South Korean woman, aged 73, was also confirmed to be infected earlier in the day. She is a family member of the couple.

Feb 9.title: Japan finds six more coronavirus cases on cruise ship
Feb 9.detail: Another six passengers on a cruise ship quarantined in Japan have been infected with the new coronavirus. That brings the total number of infections on the Diamond Princess cruise ship to 70, making it the biggest centre of infections outside of China. Japan's Health Minister Katsunobu Kato said Sunday (Feb 9) that the official number of infections in the country has reached 26. The minister also said the country will give priority on virus inspections to elderly people on the ship in Yokohama. There are about 600 people on the vessel who need medicine.

Feb 9.title: Taiwan records 18th coronavirus case, patient asymptomatic
Feb 9.detail: The 18th case being the son of the couple previously confirmed to have contracted the disease earlier this week. The young man in his 20s, has not shown any symptoms of the viral infection. However, medical staffers decided to test him as three in his family were already confirmed to have been infected by the SARS-like disease, including his parents (the 14th and 15th cases) and his brother (the 17th). The family went on a trip to Italy from Jan. 22 - Feb. 1, during which they made two transfers, outbound and inbound, in Hong Kong. Taiwan's Centers for Disease Control (CDC) has ruled out the possibility of a viral spread on the island, saying the origin of the family's infection is most likely to have occurred during a layover in Hong Kong.

Feb 9.title: Vietnam confirms 14th coronavirus infection case
Feb 9.detail: A 55-year-old woman in Vinh Phuc Province is Vietnam's latest confirmed case of novel coronavirus infection. This is the 9th confirmed case in the northern province alone. The woman is a neighbor of one of the eight workers of Japanese-invested Nihon Plast Company Limited sent to train for two months in China's Wuhan City, Hubei Province, the epicenter of the epidemic. Upon returning to Vietnam last month, six of the workers have been confirmed to be infected with the coronavirus. One of 23-year-old infected worker had infected three of her family members: her mother, sister and cousin. The 55-year-old woman went to the worker's house on January 28 for about one hour for Lunar New Year celebration. She exhibited symptoms like fever, headache and runny nose on February 2. The woman stayed home between Jan 29 and Feb 4.

Feb 9.title: S. Korea reports 25th confirmed case of novel coronavirus
Feb 9.detail: A 73-year-old South Korean woman, whose family members visited China from November to Jan. 31, tested positive for the contagious virus.

Feb 8.title: Seven more confirmed cases of novel coronavirus infection in Singapore
Feb 8.detail: The Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed seven additional cases of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection in Singapore. Of these, five are linked to previously announced cases. Among the new confirmed cases are a taxi driver and a private hire car driver. Case 34 is a 40-year-old female Singapore Citizen with no recent travel history to China. Case 35 is a 64-year-old male Singapore Citizen with no recent travel history to China. He worked as a taxi driver. Case 36 is a 38 year-old female Singapore Permanent Resident with no recent travel history to China. She had attended the same private business meeting as Cases 30 and 39 at Grand Hyatt Singapore from 20 to 22 January. Case 37 is a 53 year-old male Singapore Citizen with no recent travel history to China. He worked as a private hire car driver. Case 38 is a 52 year-old female Singapore Citizen with no recent travel history to China. Case 39 is a 51 year-old male Singapore Citizen with no recent travel history to China, but who had travelled to Malaysia from 23 January to 2 February. He had attended the same private business meeting as Cases 30 and 36 at Grand Hyatt Singapore from 20 to 22 January. Case 40 is a 36-year-old male Singapore Citizen with no recent travel history to China.

Feb 8.title: Chinese tourist from Wuhan is the 16th patient that has tested positive for the novel coronavirus
Feb 8.detail: A 67-year-old Chinese tourist from Wuhan is the 16th patient that has tested positive for the novel coronavirus. The patient is the mother of a friend of the 14th patient to test positive for the virus here. She is currently being treated at the Kuala Lumpur Hospital. Her condition is stable.

Feb 8.title: Five new cases in France are British nationals
Feb 8.detail: Five British nationals including a child have been diagnosed with the coronavirus in France, after staying in the same ski chalet in the Haute Savoie region in the eastern French Alps. They came into contact with a Briton who had been in Singapore. None of the patients were in a serious condition. The new outbreak is a“cluster, grouping around one original case, a British national who had returned from Singapore where he had stayed between 20 and 23 January. That Briton arrived in France on 24 January and stayed for four days. He had since returned to the UK.

Feb 8.title: Thailand reports 7 new coronavirus cases
Feb 8.detail: Thailand's public health ministry reported seven new cases of the coronavirus on Saturday (Feb 8), including three Thais and four Chinese.  One of the Thai cases was part of the group of 138 evacuated from China's coronavirus epicentre of Wuhan on Tuesday. The other two Thais had exposure to tourists. Among the four Chinese, three are members of the families of previously reported cases, while the other is a tourist from a risky area in China. The new cases brought the total reported in the country to 32, among the world's highest number of infections outside of China. Among the 32 casesr, 23 are Chinese while nine are Thais.

Feb 8.title: Taiwan confirms 17th case of coronavirus
Feb 8.detail: Newest case is a 20-year-old Taiwanese  man who transited in Hong Kong on family trip to Italy. The 20-year-old man had traveled to the southern European country with his parents Jan. 22 and returned on Feb. 1, transiting through Hong Kong International Airport both ways. The young man began to exhibit a dry cough on Jan. 27 during the family trip in Italy but that he was not tested for the coronavirus and quarantined at the hospital until Friday (Feb. 7). On Saturday, his test result was positive.

Feb 8.title: 3 new cases confirmed on Diamond Princess cruise ship, bringing total to 64
Feb 8.detail: Another 3 people on board a cruise ship off Japan's coast have tested positive for the new strain of coronavirus. The new cases raise the number of confirmed infections on board the ship to at least 64.

Feb 7.title: Two new cases of Chinese and Philippines nationals diagnosed with symptoms of the emerging coronavirus in UAE
Feb 7.detail: The patients are of Chinese and Philippines nationality. They are under observation and necessary medical care in accordance with the highest health standards in force in the country. All precautionary and preventive measures were taken to ensure the safety and security of citizens and residents in the country.

Feb 7.title: China coronavirus death toll reaches 719 after 81 new fatalities in Hubei with 34,000+ confirmed cases worldwide
Feb 7.detail: Nearly 3,000 new cases of a deadly coronavirus gripping China have been confirmed in the country's Hubei province, the epicenter of the outbreak, bringing the total disease toll to just short of 35,000, with over 700 fatalities. Some 81 additional deaths were reported from Hubei on Friday.

Feb 7.title: Wuhan virus cases in Hong Kong rise to 26
Feb 7.detail: The 26th case involves a 42-year-old man with good past health who lives in The Palazzo in Fo Tan. He developed a fever and a cough on Monday and went to the Prince of Wales Hospital, where he was admitted the same day. He is in a stable condition. The man had gone to Shenzhen Bao'an International Airport from Hong Kong on January 22 for a flight to Hebei Province.  He then flew from Hebei to Guangzhou on January 26 before visiting Macau the same day. He returned to Hong Kong from Macau by ferry on Sunday.  His domestic helper has been sent to the Prince of Wales Hospital with symptoms and quarantine is being arranged for his friend who lives with him, but who is asymptomatic.

Feb 7.title: Another coronavirus case in Bavaria had been confirmed
Feb 7.detail: The wife of a Bavarian employee of the company Webasto becomes the 14 confirmed Coronavirus case in Germany. She is being treated at the Schwabing Hospital in Munich. So far, 12 of the 14 cases in Germany are connected to that company, since a lady from China who did not know about her infection took part in a workshop with colleagues.

Feb 7.title: Vietnam Reports 13th Coronavirus Case
Feb 7.detail: Vietnam raised its tally of coronavirus cases to 13. Hanoi's health ministry reported Friday that one worker among eight who returned from Wuhan, China, tested positive for coronavirus.

Feb 7.title: Hong Kong has confirmed another case of the new virus, bringing the total so far to 25
Feb 7.detail: The 58-year-old patient is a Hong Kong man who works in Zhuhai, China and Macau.

Feb 7.title: Three more confirmed cases of novel coronavirus infection in singapore
Feb 7.detail: Case 31 is a 53 year-old male Singapore Citizen with no recent travel history to China, but had been in Malaysia on 6, 11 and 17 January 2020.  Case 32 is a 42 year-old female Singapore Citizen who has no recent travel history to mainland China.  Case 33 is a 39 year-old female Singapore Citizen who has no recent travel history to mainland China, but who had been in Malaysia from 22 to 29 January.

Feb 7.title: Wuhan woman is Malaysia’s 15th coronavirus case
Feb 7.detail: The patient is a 59-year-old woman from Wuhan, China holidaying in Johor Baru. She has been confirmed as the 15th 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) case in the country.

Feb 7.title: 41 new cases confirmed on Diamond Princess cruise ship, bringing total to 61
Feb 7.detail: Another 41 people on board a cruise ship off Japan's coast have tested positive for the new strain of coronavirus. The new cases raise the number of confirmed infections on board the ship to at least 61.Twenty people who were earlier diagnosed with the virus have already been removed from the vessel and taken to hospitals.

Feb 7.title: S. Korea reports 24th confirmed case of novel coronavirus
Feb 7.detail: The latest case involving a South Korean airlifted from the Chinese capital city of Wuhan last week. The patient has been in quarantine at a state-run facility in central South Korea.

Feb 6.title: B.C. health official identifies 2 new presumptive cases of coronavirus
Feb 6.detail: Two new cases of presumptive coronavirus have been identified in B.C. The two new patients are a man and woman in their 30s.  Both are connected to the second presumptive case of coronavirus found in the Vancouver Coastal Health region, a woman in her 50s had been in contact with family members visiting from Hubei province in China. They were told to self-isolate inside the woman's home. Henry said that further investigation within that household led to positive tests for the two new presumptive cases.

Feb 6.title: First Italian positive for Coronavirus
Feb 6.detail: The patient is a 29-year-old researcher. He is one of 56 italians repatriated from Wuhan and was quarantined in the military city of Cecchignola.

Feb 6.title: Taiwan confirms 3 more Wuhan virus cases, bringing total to 16
Feb 6.detail: Of the three new cases, two are a married couple, both in their 50s, who transited through Hong Kong from Taiwan on Jan. 22 for Italy on vacation with two other family members. After their return trip on Feb. 1, also through Hong Kong, the couple developed a fever and subsequently sought medical attention, during which tests showed that they had contracted the novel coronavirus and are currently being quarantined. The third victim is a woman, in her 40s, who visited Macau from Jan. 21-24 on holiday with three other family members. She developed a fever and immediately sought medical attention at a local hospital on Monday.

Feb 6.title: Hong Kong confirmed 2 more Wuhan coronavirus cases, bringing total to 24
Feb 6.source: Centre for Health Protection, Government of Hong Kong
Feb 6.detail: Both new cases are local cases with unknown source. One patient is a 63 years old female Hong Kong resident, who is being treated at Pamela Youde Nethersole Eastern Hospital. One patient is a 65 years old female Hong Kong resident, who is being treated at Prince of Wales Hospital.

Feb 6.title: Two more confirmed cases of novel coronavirus infection in Singapore
Feb 6.source: Ministry of Health, Government of Singapore
Feb 6.detail: Case 29 is a 41 year-old Singapore Citizen who has no recent travel history to mainland China. He was admitted to Mount Elizabeth Novena Hospital on 3 February. Subsequent test results confirmed 2019-nCov infection on 5 February.  Case 30 is a 27 year-old male Singapore Citizen who has no recent travel history to mainland China.  He is one of the four Singapore residents who attended a private business meeting at Grand Hyatt Singapore from 20 to 22 January. The meeting included participants from Hubeim China, and confirmed cases from Malaysia and South Korea. Subsequent test results confirmed 2019-nCoV infection on 6 February.

Feb 6.title: CMO confirms third case of coronavirus in England
Feb 6.detail: A further patient has tested positive for coronavirus, bringing the total number of cases in the UK to 3. The individual did not acquire this in the UK.

Feb 6.title: Germany reported 13th confirmed case
Feb 6.detail: Germany’s 13th confirmed case of the new coronavirus was the wife of an employee who was previously diagnosed with virus. Two children of company employees are among those infected.

Feb 6.title: Vietnam added 2 cases of positive coronavirus, both relatives of female workers returning from Wuhan
Feb 6.detail: Vietnam added 2 cases of positive coronavirus, both relatives of a female worker returning from Wuhan, who had previously been confirmed positive for novel coronavirus. The first case is a female, 49 years old. She is the biological mother of the female worker (23 years old) . The second case is a female, 16 years old, a student, is the younger sister of the female worker.

Feb 6.title: Fifth case of deadly virus confirmed in Queensland
Feb 6.detail: A 37-year-old woman has become the 15th person in Australia diagnosed with cronavirus - and the fifth in Queensland. The Chinese national is part of a tourist group in isolation at Gold Coast University Hospital. The woman flew into the Gold Coast from Melbourne on January 27 with eight other members of the tour group via Tigerair. The group has been in quarantine since a 44-year-old male member was the first member diagnosed on January 29.

Feb 6.title: New confirmed coronavirus case in Hong Kong
Feb 6.detail: The confirmed case involved a 55-year-old Hong Kong woman at Princess Margaret Hospital in Kwai Chung. The woman is the wife of the 56-year-old man confirmed as infected on Wednesday.

Feb 6.title: Two more coronavirus cases in Malaysia
Feb 6.detail: The 13th case is a 40-year-old Malaysian woman, who was the sister of the first recorded Malaysian case on Feb 4. The 14th is a Chinese female tourist, aged 35. who had arrived in Malaysia with her mother and three friends on Jan 25. The woman had visited several tourist sites in Kuala Lumpur. She tested positive for 2019-nCoV virus on Feb 5.

Feb 6.title: Taiwan announces 12th, 13th new cases of Wuhan virus
Feb 6.detail: Two new cases included a male in his 40s and a female in her 20s, both of whom had recently traveled to Wuhan. The man had traveled from Dalian to Wuhan on Jan. 17 and returned to Taiwan on Feb. 2.  The man developed symptoms on Feb. 3 and was officially diagnosed with the disease on Feb. 6. The woman returned to Taiwan from Wuhan via Shenzhen on Jan. 21. The woman developed symptoms on Feb. 1 and was diagnosed after going to the hospital. One of the patients works in Wuhan, while the other has lived there for a long period of time.

Feb 5.title: American Among 20 People Who Tested Positive for Coronavirus on Cruise Ship in Japan
Feb 5.detail: A traveler from the United States is among the 20 people confirmed to be infected with the novel coronavirus on a cruise ship off the Japan coast, as more than 3,500 others on the ship are confined to their rooms for 14 days to protect against further spread of the deadly virus. The Diamond Princess, operated by Carnival Corp.'s Princess Cruises, is docked near Yokohama while under the two-week quarantine.

Feb 5.title: S. Korea reports 4 more cases of novel coronavirus, total now at 23
Feb 5.detail: Of the four new cases, three are believed to be person to person transmissions involving South Korean nationals. The 20th patient is a 41-year-old woman who is a family member of a man who visited Wuhan, the epicenter of the latest outbreak. The 21st case is a 59-year-old woman who came into contact with the country's sixth patient, who in turn got the illness from a person who recently visited China. This person also infected his wife and son. The 22nd person is a family member of the 16th patient who had visited Thailand recently. The 23rd person is a Chinese woman who arrived in the country on Jan. 23.

Feb 5.title: Japan reports 37th confirmed Coronavirus Case: A Man in his 20's from Kyoto Prefecture
Feb 5.detail: The patient, Male, in his 20's, lives in Kyoto Prefecture and has been hospitalized in a hospital in Kyoto Prefecture since January 31, has been tested positive on February 4 at the Regional Health Research Institute in Kyoto Prefecture and reported. He served tourists from China (about 300 people a day), including tourists from Hubei before January 25.

Feb 5.title: Japan reports 36th confirmed Coronavirus Case: A Man in his 40's from Wuhan, China
Feb 5.detail: The patient, Male, in his 40's, is a vistor from Wuhan, China. He arrived in Japan on January 21st. His wife was diagnosed with Coronavirus infection earlier.

Feb 5.title: Wisconsin onfirms 12th Coronavirus case in the country
Feb 5.detail: Health officials confirmed Wednesday the first case of coronavirus in Wisconsin and the 12th in the country. The patient is an adult isolated at their home. The person who tested positive came in contact with a confirmed case while traveling to mainland China within the past two weeks.

Feb 5.title: Singapore confirms 4 new cases, including 6-month-old child of infected couple
Feb 5.detail: Four more cases of the coronavirus infection were confirmed by the Ministry of Health (MOH) on Wednesday (Feb 5), including the youngest patient confirmed so far, a six-month-old baby who is the child of an infected couple. Of the new cases, three are linked to the cluster of local transmissions announced on Tuesday, and one is an imported case involving a Chinese tourist from China's Wuhan city.

Feb 5.title: 3 more virus cases bring S. Korea's total to 19, two confirmed after trip to Singapore
Feb 5.detail: A 36-year-old South Korean man who returned from Singapore after attending a conference there from Jan. 18-23 tested positive for the contagious virus.  Another South Korean man, age 38, who recently visited Singapore to attend the same conference and came into contact with an infected Malaysian, also tested positive for the virus. The patients in the country's 19th and 17th cases were informed that one of the people they had been in contact with in Singapore was infected with the virus, so they visited a clinic in South Korea and were confirmed to have contracted the illness.

Feb 5.title: Two Malaysians flown back from Wuhan test positive, bringing total to 12
Feb 5.detail: The two latest victims are a 45-year-old man and his nine-year-old son. They had been flown back on a special AirAsia flight which transported 107 Malaysians and their family members from Wuhan, the epicentre of the coronavirus outbreak.

Feb 5.title: Fourth coronavirus case in Queensland confirmed as 37-year-old man from Wuhan
Feb 5.detail: A 37-year-old man from Wuhan, China, is currently isolated at the Gold Coast University Hospital. He is a member of the same tour group as the three other people in the state who have tested positive to the virus.

Feb 5.title: Three new cases in Hong Kong include wife and daughter of man who already has disease
Feb 5.detail: Three more people in Hong Kong tested positive for the new coronavirus on Wednesday. The wife and daughter of a 60-year-old man, who lives in Lam Tin and was confirmed on Tuesday to be infected, also returned a positive result in a preliminary test. The husband, who had an underlying illness, had not travelled outside the city in the 14 days before he fell ill. The third new case concerned a 56-year-old man, who also tested preliminary positive at Princess Margaret Hospital in Kwai Chung.

Feb 5.title: Philippines records 3rd Coronavirus case
Feb 5.detail: The country's third case of coronavirus is a 60-year-old Chinese woman from Wuhan, the city at the centre of the outbreak. She reported to a hospital in Bohol with a fever on January 22 after arriving in the country at Cebu from China via Hong Kong.

Feb 5.title: Another local case of Wuhan virus confirmed in HK
Feb 5.detail: Hong Kong has recorded its 18th confirmed case of the Wuhan virus on Tuesday night, with a 25-year-old man becoming the latest and youngest to be diagnosed in the city.  That brings the total of locally acquired infections to five. Sources said the man has not travelled over the past 14 days.

Feb 5.title: S. Korea reports 2 more cases of novel coronavirus, total now at 18
Feb 5.detail: South Korea on Wednesday confirmed two more cases of novel coronavirus infection, bringing the total to 18, with one of the latest cases involving a patient who had returned from Singapore. The Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) said the 17th patient is a 38-year-old South Korean man who recently visited Singapore for work and came into contact with a Malaysian who has since tested positive for the virus. The 18th person is a 21-year-old Korean woman who is the daughter of the 16th patient and was in quarantine when she tested positive for the virus.

Feb 4.title: 10 passengers stuck on Diamond Princess cruise ship infected, raising Japan tally to 35
Feb 4.detail: 10 passengers on the 'Diamond Princess' cruise ship test positive for the new coronavirus. The cruise ship has been quarantining off Daikoku Wharf off Yokohama since February 3. Quarantine of the cruise ship continues to be implemented.

Feb 4.title: 2nd presumptive case of coronavirus identified in Vancouver, B.C.
Feb 4.detail: A Vancouver-area woman in her 50s is believed to have the virus after a preliminary test came back positive Monday night. The result needs to be confirmed by the National Microbiology Lab in Winnipeg. The woman had been in contact with family visitors from Wuhan. Vancouver Coastal Health is also following up with the woman's family members.

Feb 4.title: Japan reports 23rd confirmed Coronavirus Case: A Man in his 50's from Wuhan, China
Feb 4.detail: The patient was a visitor from Wuhan, China. He came to Japan on January 22. On January 31, He was hospitalized after pneumonia was confirmed. On February 4, his Coronavirus infection test result was found to be positive.

Feb 4.title: Japan reports 22nd confirmed Coronavirus Case: A female Japanese resident in her 50's
Feb 4.detail: This patient is a female Japanese resident in her 50's living in Chiba Prefecture and returned to Japan on a charter flight from Wuhan on January 30.

Feb 4.title: Returning evacuee confirmed as Taiwan's 11th Wuhan coronavirus case
Feb 4.detail: Taiwan reported Tuesday its 11th case of the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV), confirmed as one of 247 nationals evacuated from the Chinese city of Wuhan the previous day.

Feb 4.title: Japan reports 21st confirmed Coronavirus Case: A woman in her thirties from Wuhan, China
Feb 4.detail: The patient is a woman in her thirties from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China who was visiting Chiba Prefecture for sightseeing. The woman is currently hospitalized at a medical institution in Chiba Prefecture.

Feb 4.title: Queensland confirms third coronavirus case as eight-year-old child from Wuhan, China
Feb 4.detail: The child, who is Chinese and from the virus epicentre of Wuhan, was confirmed to have the virus by Queensland health officials on Tuesday night. He was travelling in the same tour group as the 44-year-old man and a 42-year-old woman who have been confirmed as Queensland's other cases of coronavirus. The child remains in isolation at the Gold Coast University Hospital and is currently stable.

Feb 4.title: 4 locally transmitted cases among six new coronavirus patients in Singapore
Feb 4.detail: Singapore confirmed on Tuesday (Feb 4) its first locally transmitted cases of the novel coronavirus, among six new cases of the disease detected in the country. Four Singapore residents with no recent travel history to China have tested positive for the virus. One of them was a tour guide for a group of Chinese tourists, two work at a shop the group had visited, while a fourth case of local transmission was the domestic helper of one of the cases. The tour group had arrived in Singapore from China on Jan 22 and went to Malaysia from Jan 24 to 26. They re-entered Singapore via Woodlands Checkpoint at 3am on Jan 27 and flew from Changi Airport Terminal 1 at 6am. Pending confirmation from the Chinese authorities, the travellers are from Guangxi, and at least two of them have since been confirmed with 2019-nCoV infection. Another two new cases announced by the authorities on Tuesday are Singapore residents who had been evacuated from Wuhan. This brings the total number of cases in Singapore to 24.

Feb 4.title: Thailand confirms six new cases of coronavirus, including four Thais
Feb 4.detail: Thailand confirmed six new cases of the new coronavirus on Tuesday, four of them Thai nationals and two Chinese. The four Thai people included a couple who had visited Japan and two drivers who had picked up Chinese passengers in Thailand, the health ministry said.

Feb 4.title: Two more cases confirmed in Hong Kong, suspected to have been transmitted locally
Feb 4.detail: Two new cases, both in their 60s, had not travelled to mainland China recently, and health chief warns of potential for outbreak in city. The first of the new cases concerned a woman, 64, who went to work at a clothing store in Jordan, Kowloon while displaying symptoms on January 23. The department said they were not sure how many people had been in contact with the female patient, as she was in a deteriorating state and on a ventilator. The other, a 60 year-old male retiree, visited four private clinics before he was taken to hospital and later tested positive for the virus.

Feb 4.title: The 10th person with corona infection went to the workers' house in Vinh Phuc to eat and sing karaoke
Feb 4.detail: The 10th case in Vietnam positive for corona virus was PTB, female, 42 years old, worker, living in Son Loi commune, Binh Xuyen district, Vinh Phuc province. Ms. B. had close contact with a patient who was confirmed positive for corona virus on January 30. She was treated in the isolation area of ​​Binh Xuyen District Health Center, her health is stable.

Feb 4.title: First case of coronavirus confirmed in Belgium
Feb 4.detail: Belgium has reported its first confirmed coronavirus case after one of the nine Belgians repatriated from China at the weekend tested positive. The patient, whose identity was not disclosed, was said to be in good health and to have not developed any symptoms from the virus at the time of the tests

Feb 4.title: First Malaysian infected with coronavirus, total cases now 10
Feb 4.detail: Health authorities have confirmed the first case of coronavirus infection involving a 41-year-old Malaysian, bringing the total number of positive cases in the country to 10. The Malaysian, who is from Selangor, had travelled to Singapore to attend a conference from January 16 to 23. He is among the two latest positive cases in the country. The other case is a 63-year-old man from China who arrived at the KL International Airport on Jan 18.

Feb 4.title: South Korea has reported its 16th confirmed case of the novel coronavirus
Feb 4.detail: Latest patient is a South Korean woman in her 40s who returned from a trip to Thailand on January 19. She began experiencing chills a week later and was admitted to a hospital in Gwangju as her condition did not improve despite receiving treatment. The patient tested positive for the virus while in quarantine.

Feb 4.title: Việt Nam confirms 9th coronavirus caseu
Feb 4.detail: The male patient is 30 years old, from Minh Quang Commune, Tam Đảo District in the northern province of Vĩnh Phúc. He was among eight people returning from Wuhan City in China on the same flight. Four of them were infected with the virus.

Feb 4.title: 10th coronavirus case confirmed in Macau
Feb 4.detail: The 57-year-old Macau male resident had visited Guangzhou on the 25th of January, travelling back to Macau on the same day. From the 26th of January onward, he developed symptoms such as a runny nose, cough and fever. Tuesday morning he tested positive for the novel coronavirus. He has now been moved to the isolation ward.

Feb 4.title: Hong Kong reports first death
Feb 4.detail: Hong Kong's Hospital Authority reported that a 39-year-old man has died. It is the city's first death related to the coronavirus outbreak. It is second known death outside of mainland China. He was the 13th confirmed case in Hong Kong. He travelled to Wuhan by train on Jan. 21 and returned to Hong Kong on Jan. 23.

Feb 3.title: Bavarian Health Ministry announced 10th coronavirus cases in Bavaria
Feb 3.detail: The patient is an employee of the company from the district of Starnberg, which now employs a total of eight known coronavirus cases. Like six other cases, he is in the Munich Clinic Schwabing.

Feb 3.title: Bavarian Health Ministry announced 9th coronavirus cases in Bavaria
Feb 3.detail: The patient is another child of the man from the district of Traunstein, whose positive findings were announced last week. The man is an employee of the same company from the district of Starnberg that had other six adult cases known to date. All three family members who tested positively are currently in stable conditions.

Feb 3.title: 3rd coronavirus case in Kerala: All 3 had returned from Wuhan on same day
Feb 3.detail: The patient was a student who had come from Wuhan. The patient is currently in a isolation ward in a district hospital in Kanjangad and is in stable condition. All three cases of coronavirus in Kerala were students from Wuhan University who had returned from China on January 24. The two patients in Thrissur and Alappuzha were seated next to each other on the flight from Wuhan.

Feb 3.title: Việt Nam confirms 8th coronavirus case
Feb 3.detail: A 29-year-old Vietnamese woman from Vĩnh Phúc Province’s Bình Xuyên District has tested positive for coronavirus. She is among eight people who are on the same flight returning from the Chinese city of Wuhan as the three other people infected with the virus.

Feb 3.title: U.S. confirms 11th case of new coronavirus
Feb 3.detail: Officials have confirmed that a central California couple has been sickened with a new virus after the husband traveled to the Chinese city at the center of the outbreak, bringing the number of U.S. cases to 11. The couple, both 57 years old, have not left their home since the husband returned from China. This was a case of person-to-person transmission.

Feb 2.title: China says death toll hits 361 as confirmed cases rise to 17,205
Feb 2.detail: China's National Health Commission said there have been an additional 57 deaths and 2,829 new confirmed cases, as of the end of Sunday. That brings the country's total to 361 deaths and 17,205 confirmed cases, the government said.

Feb 2.title: 9th case of coronavirus confirmed in California
Feb 2.detail: Santa Clara County public health officials confirmed its second case of coronavrius, the ninth overall in the U.S.  The latest case is a woman who is a visitor to the U.S. who arrived January 23 to visit family.

Feb 2.title: Hong Kong confirms 15th Wuhan virus case
Feb 2.detail: Hong Kong health authorities on Sunday confirmed the territory’s 15th case of the Wuhan virus – a 72-year-old woman whose son was earlier found to be infected with the new coronavirus.

Feb 2.title: Germany: Ten Coronavirus Cases Confirmed
Feb 2.detail: Two evacuees from Wuhan were infected. Out of the 124 evacuees, 113 were taken to an Air Force base in Germersheim, where they will be in quarantine for at least two weeks.

Feb 2.title: 8th coronavirus case confirmed in a Macau resident
Feb 2.detail: The patient is a 64-year-old woman from Macau. She was first admitted to Conde S. Januário Hospital on the 27th of January with fever and cough symptoms. Three days later when her condition did not improve, she was transferred to Kiang Wu Hospital. She continued to have a fever and on the 1st of February, the CT scan showed she had pneumonia. This eighth case is the first time a local resident has been infected by the virus.

Feb 2.title: Vietnamese American becomes 7th confirmed novel coronavirus infection in Vietnam
Feb 2.detail: The patient is a Vietnamese American who waited for a connecting flight in the Chinese city of Wuhan for two hours on January 15 on his way from the U.S. to Vietnam. The Vietnamese American T.K.H., 73, started to show signs of the novel coronavirus infection on January 26 and was admitted to a hospital in Ho Chi Minh City on January 31. He was having a fever, coughing, and suffering shortness of breath. Tests showed that he sustained damage to his lungs, with his throat sample collected on January 31 and returning positive now. He is put on a ventilator at the Ho Chi Minh City Hospital for Tropical Diseases, with antibiotics and antiviral drugs prescribed for him.

Feb 2.title: Second case of coronavirus confirmed in Kerala
Feb 2.detail: The patient has a travel history from China. The patient has tested positive for Novel Coronavirus and is in isolation in the hospital. The patient is stable and is being closely monitored.

Feb 2.title: Philippines reports first death outside of China in coronavirus outbreak
Feb 2.detail: A 44-year-old male is confirmed as the second person with the 2019 novel coronavirus in the Philippines. He experienced fever, cough & sore throat before being admitted at San Lazaro Hospital. He passed away on 1 February 2020. This is the first reported death outside of China. The 1st confirmed case and the 2nd confirmed case are close contacts. Both are known residents of Wuhan, China.

Feb 2.title: S. Korea reports 3 more cases of novel coronavirus, total now at 15
Feb 2.detail: The 13th case involved a 28-year-old man who was one of the 368 Koreans that were brought back from the Chinese city of Wuhan on Friday. The country's 14th case is a 40-year-old Chinese woman who is a family member of the Chinese man diagnosed with the new coronavirus strain here Saturday. The man worked as a tour guide in Japan and came in contact with a Japanese man who was also diagnosed with the infection. The Chinese man arrived in South Korea on Jan. 19, but he was symptom-free upon arrival. The 15th case is a 43-year-old South Korean man who was in Wuhan, the epicenter of the current outbreak, and returned Jan. 20. Authorities said he is under observation.

Feb 1.title: China reports 304 virus deaths
Feb 1.detail: China’s death toll from a new virus increased to 304 as of the end of Saturday (Feb 1). Figures from the National Health Commission showed an increase of 45 in the death toll and 2,590 in the number of cases for a total of 14,380. Most of the country's deaths and overall cases have been in Hubei, a populous province in China's centre.

Feb 1.title: Boston confirms eighth US case
Feb 1.detail: A case of the virus has been confirmed in Boston, Massachusetts, in a man in his 20s who recently traveled to Wuhan, China, the Massachusetts Department of Public Health announced Saturday. So far, eight cases have been confirmed in the U.S: three people in California, two in Illinois and one each in Washington state, Arizona and Massachusetts.

Feb 1.title: Kwai Chung man, 80, tests positive for coronavirus
Feb 1.detail: The 80-year-old man ad made only a brief visit to the mainland recently, spending a few hours there after crossing the Lo Wu checkpoint into Shenzhen on January 10. He also took a flight to Tokyo on January 17 and joined a cruise from Yokohama with his two daughter on January 20. They arrived at the Kai Tak Cruise Terminal on January 25.

Feb 1.title: Fifth Chinese person detected with Coronavirus in UAE
Feb 1.detail: The person arrived from the Chinese city of Wuhan. He is currently receiving the necessary treatment and his health condition is stable.

Feb 1.title: Eighth coronavirus case in Bavaria
Feb 1.detail: The infected was a 33-year-old man. He works for the same Webasto company in Stockdorf, Starnberg district that linked to six other Coronavirus cases.

Feb 1.title: Japan reports 20th case of coronavirus as Abe vows new steps to combat outbreak
Feb 1.detail: The three were among the Japanese nationals who returned from the virus-hit Chinese city of Wuhanon government-chartered flights last week.

Feb 1.title: 2 new imported cases, no evidence of community spread
Feb 1.detail: The 17th case is a 47 year-old female Singapore citizen who travelled to Wuhan.She was one of the Singaporeans evacuated from Wuhan on Jan 30, and arrived in Singapore on the same day. The 18th case is a 31-year-old female Chinese national who arrived in Singapore from Wuhan on Jan 22.

Feb 1.title: SA announces first two cases in Wuhan couple
Feb 1.detail: The couple in South Australia, a man and a woman both aged 60, were from Wuhan and visiting relatives in the state.

Feb 1.title: Vietnam announced the 6th case of corona virus infection
Feb 1.detail: The patient is 25-year-old LTTH, resident in Van Luong commune, Van Ninh district, Khanh Hoa province. Ms. H. is the receptionist of a hotel on Ton Dan Street, TP. Nha Trang. She had close contact with two Chinese passengers who were diagnosed positive for new corona virus (nCoV) two weeks ago

Feb 1.title: Fourth coronavirus case confirmed in Victoria, taking the total in Australia to 10
Feb 1.detail: A woman in her 20s, a resident of Melbourne, is recovering at home. She returned from Wuhan, Hubei Provence, on January 25 and became unwell two days later.

Feb 1.title: S. Korea reports 12th confirmed case of novel coronavirus
Feb 1.detail: The latest case involves a 49-year-old Chinese man who works as a tour guide in Japan and arrived in the country on Jan. 19 through Gimpo International Airport in western Seoul. The man was acquainted with a Japanese person infected with the virus, indicating that he may be another person-to-person transmission case.

Jan 31.title: China virus death toll rises to 258
Jan 31.detail: The number of confirmed deaths from China's coronavirus outbreak has risen to 258. The number of confirmed cases is now over 11,000, based on numbers issued by the central government.

Jan 31.title: Spain confirms first case of coronavirus - Health Ministry
Jan 31.detail: A man was diagnosed with the virus on the remote island of La Gomera in the Canaries. The patient is part of a group of five people taken into observation on the island and isolated after it was found they had come into contact with a German man diagnosed with the virus.

Jan 31.title: CDC officials confirm 7th US case of coronavirus in California man who traveled to China
Jan 31.detail: An adult man who lives outside of San Francisco tested positive for the virus. The patient contracted the virus in Wuhan and has been isolated at home since

Jan 31.title: Germany confirms 7th coronavirus case
Jan 31.detail: The victim is a man who works at a company in Bavaria where five other workers had earlier tested positive.

Jan 31.title: CHP investigates additional imported case of novel coronavirus infection
Jan 31.source: Government of Hong Kong Press Release
Jan 31.detail: The patient is a 39-year-old man with underlying illness who visited Wuhan on Jan 21. He developed myalgia since January 29 and started having fever today.He is in a stable condition.

Jan 31.title: Canada has fourth case of new coronavirus
Jan 31.detail: A woman in her 20s who is a university student in London, Ont., returned to Canada from the affected area in China on Jan. 23. Health officials say the latest Ontario case is a mild one and there’s no evidence of heightened risk to the public.

Jan 31.title: First case of coronavirus confirmed in Sweden
Jan 31.detail: A patient at the Ryhov County Hospital in Jönköping, central-southern Sweden, has tested positive for the coronavirus. The patient is a woman in her 20s who landed in Sweden on January 24th after visiting the Wuhan area in China.

Jan 31.title: German coronavirus cases climb to six after child infected
Jan 31.detail: The new case is a child of an employee at the same firm where four more individuals in the Munich area were infected.

Jan 31.title: Russia Reports First Coronavirus Cases
Jan 31.detail: Russia reported its first two cases of coronavirus on Friday and said the infected people were Chinese citizens who had been quarantined.

Jan 31.title: Singaporean evacuated from Wuhan among country's 3 new cases of coronavirus, total now 16: MOH
Jan 31.detail: All three cases recently travelled to China's Wuhan, where the virus originated.

Jan 31.title: Taiwan confirms 10th coronavirus case
Jan 31.detail: Taiwan confirmed its 10th case of novel coronavirus as the husband of the ninth case in another domestic person-to-person infection. The businessman had recently returned from the Chinese city of Wuha.

Jan 31.title: Japan now has 17 confirmed coronavirus cases
Jan 31.detail: Of the three new cases, one is a female bus guide who developed a fever after working with a driver that had contracted the virus. The other two cases are men in their 30s and 50s who returned from Wuhan on government-chartered flights on Thursday. Both men showed no symptoms of the virus.

Jan 31.title: GThailand confirms first human-to-human coronavirus transmission, total cases rise to 19
Jan 31.detail: The first patient to contract the virus inside Thailand is a Thai taxi driver. The other four patients are Chinese nationals.

Jan 31.title: Coronavirus: Two cases confirmed in UK
Jan 31.detail: Two people from the same family have tested positive for coronavirus in the UK. They were guests at the Staycity apartment-hotel in York, before being taken to the Royal Victoria Infirmary in Newcastle

Jan 31.title: S. Korea Reports 4 More Coronavirus Cases, Raising Total Infections To 11
Jan 31.detail: The eighth case is a 62-year-old South Korean woman who visited Wuhan and came home on January 23. Exact details of the other three confirmed infections are not yet known.

Jan 31.title: Korea confirms 7th coronavirus patient
Jan 31.detail: The seventh confirmed patient is a 28-year-old male who entered into Incheon International Airport from Wuhan, Hubei Province, via Qingdao, on Jan 23.

Coronavirus outbreak: WHO expert says countries must shift mindset to virus preparedness

travel_ban.annoucement: Japan will bar foreign travelers from China's Zhejiang Province effective Thursday. Entry will also be denied to holders of Chinese passports issued in the eastern Chinese province. Japan has already taken a similar step targeting visitors from Hubei Province.
Saudi Arabia bans citizens, residents from travel to China amid coronavirus outbreak. It warned that any residents of the Kingdom who violate this order will not allowed to return to Saudi Arabia.
Effective February 8, all travelers arriving from mainland China will face a compulsory 14-day quarantine on reaching Hong Kong. The legislation will come into effect at midnight on February 8.

Antigua and Barbuda, the Bahamas, Jamaica, Dominica, and Trinidad and Tobago have all announced China-related travel bans, even though there are no direct commercial flights between mainland China and their nations. The Dominican Republic and Haiti, which share the island of Hispaniola, prevented Chinese visitors on a private jet from getting off the plane over the weekend.

Effective Monday Febuary 3rd, Indonesian bans visitors who have stayed in China for 14 days or more from visiting or transiting in Indonesia.  The Indonesian government will suspend visa-free and visa on arrival provisions for Chinese citizens.

New Zealand announced on Sunday it would bar entry into the country from all foreign nationals arriving from or has transited through mainland China after February 2 due too the increasing threat from the coronavirus epidemic. New Zealand citizens and permanent residents returning to New Zealand can still enter the country, as can their immediate family members. The ban will be in effect for up to 14 days, reviewed every 48 hours.

Philippines announced Sunday a temporary travel ban on all foreigners coming from China, Hong Kong, and Macau. Passengers who will transit through China and its territories are also covered by the travel ban.

South Korea announced on Sunday that it will bar entry to all foreign nationals who have been in China’s Hubei province in the past two weeks. The restrictions will go into effect Tuesday, February 4.
All Schengen member countries but France, have halted the admission of Schengen Visa applications and visa issuance, in the light of the current Coronavirus alert.

Chinese nationals from Guangdong Province will be prohibited entry into Taiwan starting Sunday February 2, while travelers who have recently been there will be subject to a mandatory 14-day home quarantine.
Iran has banned air travelers from China in an effort to keep out the coronavirus.
Russia said on Saturday it will suspend visa-free travel for tourists to and from China starting February 2 to help contain the outbreak of a new coronavirus that emerged in China.

Effective Sunday, February 2, at 5pm Eastern time, Foreign nationals who have visited China within 14 days of seeking admission to the United States will be denied entry, with the exception of lawful permanent residents, immediate family members of U.S. citizens and lawful permanent residents, and certain others.
Effective Sunday, February 2, New visitors of any nationality with recent travel history to mainland China will not be allowed to enter or transit in Singapore.
Effective Saturday, February 1, Bar foreign nationals who visited China's Hubei Province or who had passports issued in Hubei from entering the country.

Effective Saturday, February 1, Bar non-citizens arriving from China from entering the country. Australian citizens, Australian residents, dependents, legal guardians or spouses would be permitted into the country from China.
Armenia will suspend its visa-free travel regime for Chinese citizens from Feb. 1 until March. 31, over the coronavirus outbreak.

Effective immediately, Anyone who had visited China over the past two weeks who is not an Israeli citizen or permanent resident will now be banned from entering the country through a land or sea crossing until further notice. The ban does not apply to those who have a valid ticket for a flight that departs from Israel within six hours of the time they entered the country.

Russia shut its 4,209-kilometer (2,615 mile) land border with China to most passenger travel as the Kremlin seeks to prevent the spread of the deadly coronavirus from its biggest trading partner. The restriction affects the movement of people, not of freight.
Hanoi has introduced a temporary ban on all tourist visas for people from the worst affected areas of China.
Nepal's Rasuwagadhi border with China will be closed starting Janurary 29th for 15 days to prevent the spread of coronavirus after a rise in the number of infections in China.
Mongolia closed border crossings with China to vehicles and pedestrians and suspended university and other higher education institutions until March 2 to prevent the spread of a new viral disease.
Malaysia suspended the issuance of visas to Chinese citizens from Wuhan and the areas around Hubei province with immediate effect.

Chinese visitors from Hubei Povince will be banned from traveling to Taiwan.Chinese residents outside Hubei are also prohibited from visiting the island country for purposes including tourism, social and professional exchanges, and medical trips. Meanwhile, a two-week ban will be imposed on Chinese students planning to come to Taiwan.
North Korea closes borders to all foreign tourists as new coronavirus spreads from China.

treatment.report: China kickstarted a phase III trial Feb. 3 to determine whether patients with 2019-nCoV can be treated with Gilead Sciences Inc.'s Remdesivir, which was originally developed for Ebola, four days after a U.S. patient was said to have recovered by using the drug candidate. The study, expected to be completed on April 27, will enroll 270 patients and be carried out in the China-Japan Friendship Hospital in Beijing.

Arbidol, an antiviral drug used for treating influenza in Russia and China, could be combined with the anti-HIV drug Darunavir for treating patients afflicted with the novel coronavirus, according to a proposal by China’s National Health Commission expert Li Lanjuan.

Thai doctors have seen success in treating severe cases of the new coronavirus with combination of anti-HIV drugs lopinavir and ritonavir, and flu drug Oseltamivir in large doses. The treatment had improved the condition of several patients under their care, including one 70-year-old Chinese woman from Wuhan who tested positive for the coronavirus for 10 days. After applying this combination of medicine, her test result became negative within 48 hours.

A woman arrived in Canada from China on Friday and went to North York General Hospital in Toronto with an intermittent cough. The woman was tested for the new virus, known as COVID-19, and was sent home for self isolation because her illness was mild.

The person affected is male, in his 40s and lives in the Fraser Health region. He was in close contact with the previously reported sixth case announced on Feb. 20, 2020. Both cases remain in isolation at home with support and monitoring from public health teams.

Sunnybrook hospital received confirmation of a positive test result for COVID-19 from a patient who presented at our Emergency Department on Monday evening, February 24.  Proper isolation precautions were followed and there is no risk to others who were in the ED at that time. The patient presented with symptoms and a recent travel history to Iran.  Fortunately, the patient's condition did not require admission to hospital and the person was discharged home to follow self-isolation protocols.

The husband of a woman confirmed as Ontario's fifth case of COVID-19 has also tested positive for coronavirus. The man in his 60s is at home in Toronto in self-isolation. His only symptoms are a mild cough and fever.

The first probable case of COVID-19 has been detected in a patient who recently returned from a trip to Iran. The patient, a woman, went to a clinic in the Montreal region on Monday with minor symptoms.  Measures were quickly put in place to protect the health network and the community,  The woman did not take public transit to get to the clinic, and she hadn't gone back to work since returning from Iran.

must_read.headline: Japanese woman confirmed as COVID-19 case for 2nd time, weeks after initial recovery
must_read.detail: A woman, in her forties, working as a tour-bus guide in Japan tested positive for the coronavirus for a second time, Osaka's prefectural government said on Wednesday (Feb 26). The woman, a resident of Osaka in western Japan, tested positive on Wednesday after developing a sore throat and chest pains. She first tested positive in late January and was discharged from the hospital after recovering on Feb 1.

must_read.headline: Largest study suggests elderly and sick are most at risk
must_read.detail:
The study includes a detailed breakdown of the 44,672 confirmed cases across all of China.

It finds that 80.9% of infections are classified as mild, 13.8% as severe and only 4.7% as critical. The number of deaths among those infected, known as the fatality rate, remains low but rises among those over 80 years old.

Looking at the sex ratio, men are more likely to die (2.8%) than women (1.7%).

The study also identifies which existing illnesses put patients at risk. It puts cardiovascular disease at number one, followed by diabetes, chronic respiratory disease and hypertension.

must_read.headline: Revealed: the protein 'spike' that lets the 2019-nCoV coronavirus pierce and invade human cells
must_read.detail: 2019-nCoV binds to ACE2 with much higher affinity (10-20 times higher!) than SARS. In other words, 2019-nCoV’s 'key' is a lot 'stickier' than the SARS one. It’s like a SARS 'key' covered in superglue.

must_read.headline: Wuhan coronavirus could cause male infertility
must_read.detail: A scientific research project found that the COVID-19 disease not only damages the lungs, but also the kidneys and testicular tissues, potentially leading to male infertility. Kidney dysfunction occurs in 3 to 10 percent of novel coronavirus infection.

must_read.headline: Lung Biopsy of Deceased China Patient Shows SARS-Like Damage
must_read.detail: Doctors studying a 50-year-old man who died in China last month from the new coronavirus found that the disease caused lung damage reminiscent of two prior coronavirus-related outbreaks, SARS and MERS.

must_read.headline: How the New Coronavirus Spreads and Progresses – And Why One Test May Not Be Enough
must_read.detail: Evidence from the case in Washington State suggests that the severity of the illness does not necessarily correlate with levels of the coronavirus in the body – meaning someone can be very infectious without seeming very sick.

must_read.headline: Coronavirus: the new disease Covid-19 explained
must_read.detail: Everything you need to know about the coronavirus via infographics

must_read.headline: Single-cell RNA expression profiling of ACE2, the putative receptor of Wuhan 2019-nCov
must_read.detail: We noticed that the only Asian donor (male) has a much higher ACE2-expressing cell ratio than white and African American donors (2.50% vs. 0.47% of all cells). This might explain the observation that the new Coronavirus pandemic and previous SARS-Cov pandemic are concentrated in the Asian area.

must_read.headline: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
must_read.detail:
There is a pattern in the reported death rates.

Less than 0.5% of patients aged under 50 have died, according to Chinese Centres of Disease Control.

However, that figure spikes rapidly to:

1.3% in their 50s

3.6% in their 60s

8% in their 70s

15% over 80

must_read.headline: Coronavirus is more fatal in men than women, major study suggests
must_read.detail: Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention data suggested that fatality rates were higher among men than women. Officials recorded a 2.8% fatality rate for male patients versus 1.7% for women.

must_read.headline: What happens if you catch the new coronavirus?
must_read.detail: 'We've seen some data on about 17,000 cases and overall 82 percent of those are mild, 15 percent of those are severe and 3 percent of those are classified as critical,' said Van Kerkhove.

must_read.headline: Australian coronavirus vaccine goes into test production
must_read.detail:
A factory in Melbourne has started producing a test dose of a potential coronavirus vaccine which scientists will begin testing on animals this week.

The test vaccine was developed in just six weeks by University of Queensland researchers using world-first molecular clamp technology invented in Australia.

must_read.headline: Masks and N95 Respirators
must_read.detail: Facemasks and N95 respirators are examples of personal protective equipment that are used to protect the wearer from liquid and airborne particles contaminating the face. They are one part of an infection-control strategy.
